problem_text:
15.72. For a fixed prime p does there exist a sequence of groups Pn of order pn such that the number of conjugacy classes k(Pn) satisfies limn→∞log k(Pn)/√n = 0?
Note that J. M. Riedl (J. Algebra, 218 (1999), 190–215) constructed p-groups for which the above limit is 2 log p.
P. P. P´alfy
